contentrichtext.text: [[image:Japan prov map iwase718.png|thumb|Map of the former Japanese provinces with Iwase highlighted]] {{nihongo|'''Iwase Province'''|石背国|Iwase no Kuni}} is an [[old provinces of Japan|old province]] of Japan lasting for a brief period of time in the [[Nara period]] in what is now western [[Fukushima Prefecture]]<ref>Kodama. (1958). 図日本文化史大系, p. 30; excerpt, [http://www.google.com/search?ie=UTF-8&oe=UTF-8&sourceid=navclient&gfns=1&q=%E7%9F%B3%E8%83%8C%E5%9B%BD#sclient=psy&hl=en&biw=800&bih=394&tbm=bks&source=hp&q=%E7%9F%B3%E8%83%8C%E5%9B%BD+718-724&aq=&aqi=&aql=&oq=%E7%9F%B3%E8%83%8C%E5%9B%BD+718-724&pbx=1&bav=on.2,or.r_gc.r_pw.&fp=48b3570d4e310ba2 石背国 718-724?]</ref> ==History== Iwase Province was created during the reign of [[Empress Genshō]].<ref name="meyners172">Meyners d'Estrey, Guillaume Henry Jean (1884). {{Google books|gzEwAAAAYAAJ|''Annales de l'Extrême Orient et de l'Afrique,'' Vol. 6, p. 172|page=172}}; excerpt, ''[[Empress Genshō|Genshō]] crée sept provinces : Idzumi, [[Noto Province|Noto]], Atoa, [[Iwaki Province (718)|Iwaki]], Iwase, [[Suwa Province|Suwa]] et [[Sado Province|Sado]] en empiétant sur celles de [[Kawachi Province|Kawachi]], [[Echizen Province|Echizen]], [[Etchū Province|Etchū]], [[Kazusa Province|Kazusa]], [[Mutsu Province|Mutsu]] and [[Shinano Province|Shinano]]''</ref> The Yōrō [[Ritsuryo]] established the Iwase Province in 718 through the division of the Michinoku Province ([[Mutsu Province]]). It was composed of five districts of Shirakawa (白河), Iwase (石背), Aizu (会津), Asaka (安積) and Shinobu (信夫). The area encompassed by the province reverted to Mutsu some time between 722 and 724. Some scholars have suggested that this innovation may have been motivated by economic considerations.<ref name="meyners172"/> == Historical districts == *[[Aizu District, Fukushima|Aizu District]] (会津郡) *[[Asaka District, Fukushima|Asaka District]] (安積郡) *[[Iwase District, Fukushima|Iwase District]] (岩瀬郡) *[[Shinobu District, Fukushima|Shinobu District]] (信夫郡) *[[Higashishirakawa District, Fukushima|Shirakawa District]] (白川郡, East Shirakawa) ==See also== * [[Iwashiro Province]], ''de facto'' brief reconstitution. * [[List of Provinces of Japan]] ==Notes== {{reflist}} ==References== * Kodama.
